title.rendered: Jasprit Bumrah vs Stuart Broad: Jasprit Bumrah flaunts Stuart Broad in the style of Yuvraj Singh, makes a shameful record by conceding 35 runs in an over

content.rendered:
In 2007 at the T20 WORLD CUP Yuvraj Singh nearly ended Stuart Board’s bowling career by hitting 6 sixes for his 6 consecutive balls. And now at the Birmingham ground Jasprit Bumrah likewise dashed Stuart Board bowls for 35 runs in an over.

If Stuart bowled the most expensive over of T20 INTERNATIONAL in 2007,

it became the costliest over in 2022 TEST CRICKET HISTORY

STUART BOARD NOW HAS THE RECORD FOR CONCEEDING THE MOST RUNS IN AN OVER IN TEST CRICKET. Earlier no bowler in Test cricket had spent more than 28 runs in an over.

TEST CRICKET: Most Runs in an Over

 35 Jasprit Bumrah      vs  Stuart Board       –  Birmingham      –  2022

28 Keshav Maharaj    vs  Joe Root              –  Port Elizabeth  –  2020

28 George Bailey Off  vs  Joe Root              –  Port Elizabeth   – 2013

28 Brian Lara                vs Robin Peterson  –  Johannesburg  – 2003

On the Birmingham ground Team India got the 9th blow on the score of 375 and Jadeeja returning to the pavilion. No one expected the team to reach 400 runs but Jasprit Bumrah had other ideas. Stuart Board brought the 84th over of the Indian innings, with Jasprit bringing in a total of 35 runs which is now a record in Test cricket history. Let us go over this fateful over with a run by run of each bowl:

  • First Ball: Jasprit played a hard shot on a short ball but the ball took the edge of the bat and went outside the fine leg boundary for 4 runs
  • Second ball: Stuart hit a bouncer. The ball crossed the boundary after Jasprit hitting the wicketkeeper as well. India got 5 runs with the umpire declaring wide. The ball took the edge of the bat after Jasprit played a strange shot with the ball crossing the boundary for six runs over the wicketkeeper. With over step by Stuart the umpire declared a no ball, India got 7 runs.
  • Third ball:  With a good length ball, Jasprit’s bat taking the edge the ball went out for 4 runs from the side of the stumps.
  • Fourth ball:  Nothing seems to hinder Jasprit, with this ball he hits 4 runs.
  • Fifth ball: The leg-stumps ball is hit outside the boundary for 6 runs. Now everyone outside the field and inside the field is surprised and the WORLD RECORD HAS BEEN SET.
  • Sixth ball: On the last ball Jasprit managed to get 1 run thus accumulating a total of 35 RUNS in this over. THIS IS THE MOST RUNS IN AN OVER IN TEST CRICKET.

Read Also: India vs England 2022: Cricket world in awe of Rishabh Pant’s Edgbaston heroics
